LOS 58.j
If immediate exercise of an option would generate a positive payoff, the option is in the
money. If immediate exercise would result in a negative payoff, the option is out of the
money. An option's exercise value is the greater of zero or the amount it is in the money.
Time value is the amount by which an option's price is greater than its exercise value.
Time value is zero at expiration.
